diff.*:
Line 37: Line 37:      
‘'''W'''isdom’, from a scientific perspective, is viewed as an integral component of the ‘'''D'''ata’ to ‘'''I'''nformation’ to ‘'''K'''nowledge’ learning pathway.
 
‘'''W'''isdom’, from a scientific perspective, is viewed as an integral component of the ‘'''D'''ata’ to ‘'''I'''nformation’ to ‘'''K'''nowledge’ learning pathway.
−   −
The word ‘[[science]]’ derives from the latin term ‘scientia’, meaning ‘having knowledge’.
  −
Scientically, ‘Knowledge’ lies along a continuum between ‘Information / Data’ and ‘Wisdom’.
  −   −
Collectively, these inter-related hierarchical elements are termed the [[DIKW]] scientific learning pathway.
  −   −
'''K'''nowledge, from a scientific perspective, is generally viewed as ‘the ability to predict response-patterns, based upon evidence collected by the [[scientific method]]'. All scientific knowledge is derived from scientific ‘'''I'''nformation’: Some experts define scientific ‘knowledge’ as ‘information in context’.
  −   −
'''I'''nformation, from a scientific perspective, is a configuration of '''D'''ata, collected by the scientific method, that reveals new significant relationships. Functionally, scientific ‘information’ tends to be experienced as ‘a demand upon the observer’s attention’. Some experts define scientific ‘information’ as ‘data in context’.
  −   −
'''D'''ata, in turn, is viewed by scientists as the ‘infinite facts of the universe’, and thus forms the root basis of all scientific observation and discovery.
       
‘'''W'''isdom’, from a scientific perspective, could be viewed simply as ‘knowledge in context’. Yet functionally, ‘'''W'''isdom’ is far more textured and multidimensional.
 
‘'''W'''isdom’, from a scientific perspective, could be viewed simply as ‘knowledge in context’. Yet functionally, ‘'''W'''isdom’ is far more textured and multidimensional.
